page.title: 03Population of Saxilby Area
page.content: In 1801 Saxilby had a population of 309. The increasing importance of the canal as a communication link , plus the railway, caused the population to nearly treble by 1850. The opening of 2 engineering works in the early years of the 20th century brought the population steadily to 1636 by 1961. Subsequent growth has given the village importance as a dormitory settlement for Lincoln increasing the population to its present approximate 3200 people including Ingleby. The population of Broxholme is around 50 including 8 children. Saxilby appeals to young couples moving on in 2 or 3 years due to job changes and also to RAF families, so there is a constant trickle of new blood in and out of the village. Despite this, school rolls are falling and the elderly form a high proportion of the inhabitants.
